comments:
Downloaded I20030909 and tried to run on my existing workspace. Eclipse won't 
start and instead said to look in the .log file for details. If zipped my 
workspace if that is of any help.

org.eclipse.ui.workbench.
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:856)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:461)
	... 7 more

It looks like there is a problem with one of the project description files
(.project). The XML parser is throwing an exception, and the project description
reader tries to create a corresponding status object. But the exception does not
have a message set (what is valid) and the Status constructor requires a
non-null message.

Fix is to ensure in ProjectReader that a non-null string is passed as a message
to Status constructor.

I cannot reproduce it with Jean-Michel's workspace. Unfortunately the error that
caused Eclipse to crash happened when logging the original problem, so it is
hard to understand what actually happened - although I would say it was a NPE
generated in one of the parsing callback methods implemented by
ProjectDescriptionReader. 

Fixed the logging code and released to HEAD. At least next time this happens we
will know what the problem actually is.
